<h1>Write C# instead of JavaScript</h1>
SharpKit is a Web Toolkit that enables you to write C# and convert it to JavaScript during compilation. In this tutorial, we will create a simple web application in Html and C#. The C# code will be compiled into JavaScript using SharpKit.

<img src='http://skmedia.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/skmedia/sharpkit/images/Hello_SharpKit/files.jpg' />

<h3>Creating a new SharpKit Web Application</h3>
  * Make sure you've downloaded and installed  the <a href='http://code.google.com/p/sharpkit-jquery/wiki/Downloads'>SharpKit SDK</a>

  * In Visual Studio select <b>File > New Project</b>

  * Under My Templates Select <b>SharpKit Web Application</b>. 

  * Name your project "HelloWorld" and click <b>OK</b>. 
On the newly created project, note the following files: 

<b>index.htm</b>
{{{
ï»¿<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
  <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
  <head>
   <title>HelloWorld</title>
   <script src="index.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
  </head>
  <body>
    <button id="btn" onclick="btn_click();return false;">Click me!</button>
  </body>
</html>

}}}

<b>index.cs</b>
{{{
using SharpKit.JavaScriptModel;
using SharpKit.HtmlModel;

namespace HelloWorld
{
	[JsType(JsMode.Global, "index.js")]
	public class index : HtmlContext
	{
		public static void btn_click()
		{
			alert("Hello World!");
		}
	}
}

}}}

  * Click <b>Compile</b> and review the generated JavaScript file:

<b>index.js</b>
{{{

void btn_click()
{
  alert("Hello World!");
}
}}}

  * Click <b>Run</b> and browse to the index.htm file
